if (empty($modlogtypes['trackback_x_edited'])) { $blogmodlogtypes = array( 'blogentry_removed' => 100, 'blogentry_softdeleted' => 101, 'blogentry_undeleted' => 102, 'blogentry_approved' => 103, 'blogentry_unapproved' => 104, 'blogentry_title_x_changed_to_y' => 105, 'blogentry_x_edited' => 106, 'comment_x_by_y_removed' => 107, 'comment_x_by_y_softdeleted' => 108, 'comment_x_by_y_undeleted' => 109, 'comment_merged_from_multiple_comments' => 110, 'comments_copied_to_x' => 111, 'trackback_approved' => 112, 'trackback_unapproved' => 113, 'trackback_x_edited' => 114, );
$modlogtypes = array_merge($modlogtypes, $blogmodlogtypes); }

phrasetype.name: Control Panel Help Text
phrasetype.phrase: This permission controls soft deletion for blog comments, enabling this will provide the option to simply hide the comments from view to non moderators.
This permission controls soft deletion for blog entries, enabling this will provide the option to simply hide the entries from view to non moderators.
This permission controls removal of blog entries, if this permission is granted entries can be removed permanently from the database.

This page contains several counters that you can update.

Rebuild Blog Entry Information:
This feature will rebuild the total comments, trackbacks and last post information for each blog entry.

Rebuild Blog User Information:
This will rebuild the total entry count for categories as well as the total entries, comments, trackbacks and last post information for each blog.

Rebuild Blog Counters:
This will rebuild the total entry count for categories, total attachments and trackbacks for a blog entry.

Clear Parsed Text Cache:
This will clear all the current cached text entries, this may be useful if you have added or changed permissions on a bbcode or other settings affecting post output.

Rebuild Attachment Thumbnails:
Rebuilding thumbnails is necessary after changing your thumbnail settings in your vBulletin options.
This permission controls removal of blog comments, if this permission is granted comments can be removed permanently from the database.
You can specify a style that will apply only to blog pages, this will allow the blogs to have a different style to that of the main forum.
This setting controls permission for the soft deletion of blog entries.
This setting controls permission for the removal of blog entries, once removed the entry will no longer be available within the database.

If set to Yes this follows the moderation option defined within the blog options and the settings of the blog the comment is being posted to, if set to No the comments for this usergroup will always be moderated.
If set to Yes this follows the moderation option defined within the blog options, if set to No the entries for this usergroup will always be moderated.

phrasetype.name: Control Panel Options
phrasetype.phrase: Any option may be left blank

phrasetype.phrase: Can Manage Comments within Own Blog

Can Post Comments to Own Blog

Follow Blog Comment Moderation Setting<dfn>If no, comments are always placed into moderation queue</dfn>
Follow Profile Comment Moderation Setting <dfn>If no, comments are always placed into moderation queue</dfn>

This script executes four times an hour to process pending entries that are ready to go active.
This script executes once an hour to process attachment and blog views.

phrasetype.name: Email Body Text
phrasetype.phrase:
Dear $touser[username],
$username has just replied to a blog entry you have subscribed to entitled - $entrytitle - in the $blogtitle blog of $vboptions[bbtitle].
This entry is located at: $vboptions[bburl]/blog.php?blogid=$blogid&goto=newpost
Here is the message that has just been posted: *************** $pagetext ***************
There may also be other comments, but you will not receive any more notifications until you visit the forum or blog again.
All the best, $vboptions[bbtitle]
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ Unsubscription information:
To unsubscribe from this blog entry, please visit this page: $vboptions[bburl]/blog_subscription.php?do=unsubscribe&blogsubscribeentryid=$touser[blogsubscribeentryid]&auth=$touser[auth]

$reportinfo[rusername] ( mailto:$bbuserinfo[email] ) has reported this blog comment:
$vboptions[bburl]/blog.php?bt=$blogtextinfo[blogtextid]
This is part of this blog entry: $reportinfo[emtrytitle] $vboptions[bburl]/blog.php?b=$bloginfo[blogid]
This is the reason that the user gave: $reportinfo[reason]
A discussion thread has been created at $vboptions[bburl]/showthread.php?t=$rpthreadid
This message has been sent to all moderators of this blog, or all administrators if there are no moderators.
Please respond to this comment as applicable.

$reportinfo[rusername] ( mailto:$bbuserinfo[email] ) has reported this blog comment:
$vboptions[bburl]/blog.php?bt=$blogtextinfo[blogtextid]
This is part of this blog entry: $reportinfo[entrytitle] $vboptions[bburl]/blog.php?b=$bloginfo[blogid]
This is the reason that the user gave: $reportinfo[reason]
This message has been sent to all moderators of this blog, or all administrators if there are no moderators.
Please respond to this comment as applicable.

[url=$vboptions[bburl]/member.php?u=$bbuserinfo[userid]]$reportinfo[rusername][/url] has also reported this blog comment.
Reason:[quote]$reportinfo[reason][/quote]

[url=$vboptions[bburl]/member.php?u=$bbuserinfo[userid]]$reportinfo[rusername][/url] has reported a blog comment.
Reason:[quote]$reportinfo[reason][/quote] Comment: [url=$vboptions[bburl]/blog.php?bt=$blogtextid]$reportinfo[entrytitle][/url] Blog: $reportinfo[blogtitle] Assigned Moderators: $modlist
Posted by: [url=$vboptions[bburl]/member.php?u=$bloginfo[userid]]$reportinfo[pusername][/url] Original Content: [quote]$blogtextinfo[pagetext][/quote]

$reportinfo[rusername] ( mailto:$bbuserinfo[email] ) has reported this blog entry:
$reportinfo[entrytitle] $vboptions[bburl]/blog.php?b=$bloginfo[blogid]
This is part of this blog: $reportinfo[blogtitle] $vboptions[bburl]/blog.php?u=$reportinfo[puserid]
This is the reason that the user gave: $reportinfo[reason]
A discussion thread has been created at $vboptions[bburl]/showthread.php?t=$rpthreadid
This message has been sent to all moderators of this blog, or all administrators if there are no moderators.
Please respond to this entry as applicable.

$reportinfo[rusername] ( mailto:$bbuserinfo[email] ) has reported this blog entry:
$reportinfo[entrytitle] $vboptions[bburl]/blog.php?b=$bloginfo[blogid]
This is part of this blog: $reportinfo[blogtitle] $vboptions[bburl]/blog.php?u=$reportinfo[puserid]
This is the reason that the user gave: $reportinfo[reason]
This message has been sent to all moderators of this blog, or all administrators if there are no moderators.
Please respond to this entry as applicable.

[url=$vboptions[bburl]/member.php?u=$bbuserinfo[userid]]$reportinfo[rusername][/url] has also reported this blog entry.
Reason:[quote]$reportinfo[reason][/quote]

[url=$vboptions[bburl]/member.php?u=$bbuserinfo[userid]]$reportinfo[rusername][/url] has reported a blog entry.
Reason:[quote]$reportinfo[reason][/quote] Entry: [url=$vboptions[bburl]/blog.php?b=$blogid]$reportinfo[entrytitle][/url] Blog: $reportinfo[blogtitle] Assigned Moderators: $modlist
Posted by: [url=$vboptions[bburl]/member.php?u=$bloginfo[userid]]$reportinfo[pusername][/url] Original Content: [quote]$bloginfo[pagetext][/quote]

Dear $touser[username],
$username has posted a new entry in their blog: $blogtitle blog of $vboptions[bbtitle] titled '$entrytitle'
This entry is located at: $vboptions[bburl]/blog.php?blogid=$blogid
Here is the message that has just been posted: *************** $pagetext ***************
There may also be other comments, but you will not receive any more notifications until you visit the forum or blog again.
All the best, $vboptions[bbtitle]
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ Unsubscription information:
To unsubscribe from this user's blog, please visit this page: $vboptions[bburl]/blog_subscription.php?do=unsubscribe&blogsubscribeuserid=$touser[blogsubscribeuserid]&auth=$touser[auth]

phrasetype.name: FAQ Text
phrasetype.phrase: The Blog system gives you your own personal space at $vboptions[bbtitle]. Depending on how the administrator has configured the blog, you will be able to create your own entries and control who may view them.
The blog sidebar contains the links to maintain your blog as well as information in regards to your blog and the other blogs that you may visit.

You may categorize entries in multiple categories of your own creation. Before you may categorize entries, you must define your categories in the Blog Control Panel.

After creating your categories, you will be able to select multiple categories from the blog entry page during the creation of a new entry, or by editing an existing entry.

If you are allowed to post blog entries, you will always have a link in the blog sidebar titled "Post to your Blog". This link allows you to post entries immediately, entries that will post automatically at a future date, or create a draft entry for later review and posting.

Draft entries allow you to compose an entry in stages. To create a draft entry, create an entry as normal but before submitting the entry, find Publish Status in the Miscellaneous Options on the lower section of the entry creation page. This option defaults to Publish Now.

Change Publish Now to Draft and then save. Alternatively, you may press the Save Draft button at any time.

Your Pending and Draft entries are only viewable by you until they are published.

You may also post entries that have a time stamp in the past. This is useful for those entries that you just forgot to post and they work best in chronological order.

To past date an entry, create an entry as normal but before submitting the entry, find Publish Status in the Miscellaneous Options on the lower section of the entry creation page. This option defaults to Publish Now.

Change Publish Now to Publish On and then choose the date and time that you wish for the entry to appear to have been posted. If you select a date in the future, you will be creating a Pending Entry.

Entries that you wish to create now but have them become publicly available at a later time are referred to as Pending Entries. To create a pending entry, create an entry as normal but before submitting the entry, find Publish Status in the Miscellaneous Options on the lower section of the entry creation page. This option defaults to Publish Now.

Change Publish Now to Publish On and then choose the date and time that you wish for the entry to go live. Due to the architecture, pending entries can appear a few minutes later than the time that you specify but they will have a time stamp that matches the date and time that you choose.

Your Pending and Draft entries are only viewable by you until they are published.

The Allow comments to be posted option controls the commenting ability of your viewers. When this option is disabled, only you and blog moderators will be able to comment on the entry. If you are allowed to edit entries, you may turn this option on and off after an entry has been published to control the commenting ability as time passed.

You may set the default for this choice in the Blog Control Panel.

The Moderate comments before posting option controls the visibility of comments. When this option is enabled, comments by anyone other than you and blog moderators are invisible until you approve them. If you are allowed to edit entries, you may turn this option on and off after an entry has been published to control the visibility of new comments as time passed.

You may set the default for this choice in the Blog Control Panel.

The Notify blogs linked within this blog entry and Send Trackback / Pingback to options allow you to notify other blogs that you have posted an entry in regard to them. You should always include the link to the other blog entry in your entry. Once you send the pingback request, the other blog is going to request your entry and verify that you really did include the link. If you are allowed to edit entries, you may still send pingback notices after the entry has been published.

This option will not appear if trackbacks / pingbacks have been disabled by the administrator.

The Allow trackback / pingback option controls the usability of trackbacks and pingbacks. When this option is enabled, other blogs may post trackback (or pingback) entries to your blog. Trackback and pingback entries are always moderated by default so they will not be seen by anyone else until you approve them. If you are allowed to edit entries, you may turn this option on and off after an entry has been published.

You may set the default for this choice in the Blog Control Panel.

This option will not appear if trackbacks / pingbacks have been disabled by the administrator.

phrasetype.name: vBulletin Settings
phrasetype.phrase: Provide an Akismet key to enable spam scanning of all new trackbacks and blog comments. You may need a commercial key depending on usage, please see http://akismet.com/
The number of categories that can be associated with each blog entry.
The total number of blog categories a user can create.
The number of comments to show per page when viewing a blog entry.

The blog often needs to wrap long unbroken text strings at a lower value than vBulletin does for posts. If you want the blog to automatically insert spaces into long words to make them wrap after a certain number of characters, set the number of characters in the box above.

To disable word wrap, enter 0.
Number of Characters Before Wrapping Text

Comments that contain more characters than the value specified here will be rejected with a message telling the user to shorten their comment.

Set the value to 0 to disable this function.

When a comment is submitted or edited vBulletin will check the number of images and smilies in the text and reject it if the number is greater than the value specified here.

Set the value to 0 to disable this function.
When enabled, all new comments are placed into moderation. This can also be enabled in usergroup permissions.
The blog options on the New User creation form in in the Admin Control Panel, as well as the blog options form will default to the following settings.

You can limit the number of draft entries that a user may posess.

Set the value to 0 to disable this function.

Entries that contain more characters than the value specified here will be rejected with a message telling the user to shorten their entry.

Set the value to 0 to disable this function.

When an entry is submitted or edited vBulletin will check the number of images and smilies in the text and reject it if the number is greater than the value specified here.

Set the value to 0 to disable this function.
On the main Blog page, a single blog entry is featured. You may choose for this entry to be randomly selected or you may choose a specific entry.
The maximum number of entries to display on a page before splitting it over multiple pages.
Maximum Displayed Entries Before Page Split
This option enables the display of full Next / Previous entry links with the entry title. By default, only "Next" and "Previous" is shown.
You may limit the number of link notifications that are sent with each entry. The user will be able to choose which links to notify at post time.

You can limit the number of entries that a user may have pending.

Set the value to 0 to disable this function.
The default number of entries to display on a page before splitting it over multiple pages.
This option enables vBulletin Blog to receive pingback notices. Pingback notices can be spam heavy and may increase server bandwidth depending on the amount of pingbacks received.
When enabled, all new blog entries are placed into moderation. This can also be enabled in usergroup permissions.
The minimum number of votes that a blog entry must receive before its rating appears.
The minimum number of combined post votes that a blog must receive before its rating appears.
This is the default length of the blog entry snippets shown on the user's main blog page and featured blog.
You may choose to override your forum's default style, or the user's chosen style with a specific style for the blog.
This option enables vBulletin Blog to receive trackback notices. Trackback notices are spam heavy and may increase server bandwidth depending on the amount of trackbacks received.

Blog descriptions that contain more characters than the value specified here will be rejected with a message telling the user to shorten their description.

Set the value to 0 to disable this function.

When a blog description is submitted or edited vBulletin will check the number of images and smilies in the text and reject it if the number is greater than the value specified here.

Set the value to 0 to disable this function.
